: If your app processes user requests at the network edge, isolates can handle JavaScript execution without spinning up full VMs. Cloudflare Workers uses this to run code globally with minimal overhead.
: For services that need rapid scaling, isolates provide isolation without the weight of containers. This reduces cold-start times from seconds to milliseconds.
: Break features into isolated modules that can run in separate V8 contexts. This mirrors microservices but at a finer grain, improving fault tolerance.
: Allocate CPU and memory per isolate, ensuring fair sharing. Tools like Deno or Node.js with worker threads can prototype this.
: Isolates provide sandboxing, reducing attack surfaces. Integrate this early to avoid retrofitting security later.
: Deploy isolates within containers for portability, or use VMs to manage isolate pools. Kubernetes can orchestrate this, with isolates as pods for fine-grained scaling.
: From day one, instrument for isolate-specific metrics like heap usage or execution time. Tools like Prometheus can track these, ensuring efficiency goals are met.
